Description: Egyptian terracotta figure of merchant wearing cloak, carrying purse. Head missing. Mould-made and hollow with vent at back. Red-brown Nile silt fabric with dark brown core. Abundant fine gold mica, quartz, organic and white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Probably locally produced at the Naukratis Terracottas workshop that was operational from the 3rd to 2nd century BC. Parallels from Egypt are dated 2nd to 1st century BC (Bayer-Niemeier 1988; pl. 4.1-3, no. 24-6; Fischer 1994; pl. 17, no. 200). Good parallel from Athribis (Tell Atrib) dated to the early 3rd century BC (Szmańska 2005; no. 175) and the Fayum (Kaufmann 1915; no. 401-2). Bayer-Niemeier, E. 1988. Liebieghaus Museum Alter Plastik. Bildwerke der Sammlung Kaufmann, 1. Griechisch-römische Terrakotten. Melsungen. Fischer, J. 1994. Griechisch-römische Terrakotten aus Ägypten. Die Sammlungen Sieglin und Schreiber. Dresden, Leipzig, Stuttgart, Tübingen. Tübingen: Wasmuth. Kaufmann, C. M. 1915, Greco-ägyptische Koroplastik. Terrakotten der griechisch-römischen und koptischen Epoche aus der Faijûm-Oase und andren Fundstätten, Cairo. Szymańska, H. 2005, Terres cuites d’Athribis, Turnhout.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.304) (Phase 1)
